content.description: Consider the constant function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals negative 1"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and the function <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 3 x"> <mi>g</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mi>x</mi> </math>. Let <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> be the function given by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals g open parentheses x close parentheses minus f open parentheses x close parentheses"> <mi>h</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>-</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> </math>.
content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, what is the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-intercept of the graph of <math alttext="h"> <mi>h</mi> </math> ?

choices.label: The graph of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> does not have an <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-intercept.

topic.text: 2.13: Exponential and Logarithmic Equations and Inequalities

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
